I'm pleased that the feedback, though not phrased the best, is valued by
those working on JUnit.  I didn't expect otherwise, but I wasn't sure that I
would be able to post my conversation without presenting "DS" as attacking
JUnit.  He wasn't; he was simply frustrated with some of the difficulties of
expanding the scope of JUnit to do the testing that he wanted with EJB-based
systems.

This thread is a good one for me.  I'm curious now to read about how to
become involved.  I hope that my schedule will allow it.

Regards,
Craig
